revision.comment: /* top */ clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = 1 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY57V643220CT-7; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = <!-- Radio module name, optional link, Leave blank for none --> |rad1modif = PCMCIA (32-bit) |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR5210B;AR5210B-00, DC1251.00B, 4201, Taiwan; |rad1chip2 = Atheros;AR5110; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = UMP2.0 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== '''PN4040''' / '''Model 4040'''
Per the FCC technical description... *the (stock) usable frequency range of the device is 5180-5320MHz w/ 20MHz wide and stepped channels *the device has a (stock) maximum output power of 50mW **peak antenna gain for the stock antennas is 6dBi
==Links of Interest== [http://web.archive.org/web/20030205222136/http://www.proxim.com/products/all/skyline/pn4040/ Product page (via archive.org)]
